mkdir -p basic
echo "node_modules" >> basic/.gitignore echo "dist" >> basic/.gitignore echo ".cache" >> basic/.gitignore echo '{"scripts":{"start":"parcel src/","build":"parcel build src/index.html"}}' > basic/package.json

mkdir -p src touch src/index.html touch src/styles.css touch src/main.js
npm start

section.title: babel stage-0
section.simpara: parcel needed only .babelrc file and installed required presets

formalpara.title: add .babelrc file, install and configure presets: env and stage-0

para.programlisting: cp -Rf basic babel-stage-0 cd babel-stage-0/ echo '{"presets":["env","stage-0"]}' > .babelrc npm i -D babel-preset-env babel-preset-stage-0

formalpara.title: now you can use some cool JS features:
for React you need even less: just install react library and parcel will recognize everything for you!

para.programlisting: cp -Rf babel-stage-0 react cd react/ npm i -S react react-dom npm i -D babel-preset-react echo '{"presets":["env","react"]}' > .babelrc

formalpara.title: and update code in src/main.js file:
do necessary updates from react example:

para.programlisting:
cp -Rf react preact cd preact/
npm rm react react-dom babel-preset-react
npm i -S preact preact-compat npm i -D babel-preset-preact babel-plugin-transform-class-properties
echo '{"presets":["env","preact"],"plugins":["transform-class-properties"]}' > .babelrc

formalpara.title: to be able build vue apps, in addition to babel example you only need install vue and two dev packages:

para.programlisting: cp -Rf babel-stage-0 vue cd vue/ npm i -S vue npm i -D babel-preset-vue @vue/component-compiler-utils vue-template-compiler echo '{"presets":["env","vue"]}' > .babelrc

formalpara.title: to be able to parse YAML we need js-yaml package:

para.programlisting: cp -Rf basic yaml cd yaml/ npm i -ES js-yaml
app: map: key: value list: - value 1 - value 2

formalpara.title: to be able to parse YAML we need parcel-plugin-markdown package:

para.programlisting: cp -Rf basic markdown cd markdown/ npm i -ED parcel-plugin-markdown
